name: Katy Christian Ministries Food Pantry
description: Large food pantry providing supplemental groceries and personal care items with connected social services and case management for Katy/West Houston-area residents.

name: Katy Christian Ministries Social Services
description: Assistance with rent, utilities, prescriptions, gasoline, and other basic needs for households in the greater Katy area, plus referrals to other services.

name: Fort Bend County Social Services – Food Assistance
description: County food assistance for Fort Bend residents meeting program guidelines; requires documentation and scheduled appointments.

name: Fort Bend County Social Services – General Assistance
description: Emergency assistance for eligible residents, including help with food, shelter, utilities, prescriptions, and documented crises.

name: Harris County Housing Authority – Food Resources (Housing Resource Center referrals)
description: Referral listings for food resources in Harris County, including direction to the Houston Food Bank pantry locator and SNAP help.

name: Harris County – Uplift Harris
description: County initiative providing direct cash assistance for selected eligible low-income households to cover basic needs such as rent, groceries, utilities, and healthcare.

name: United Way of Greater Houston – Everyday Basic Needs
description: Safety-net navigation and connections to local food, housing, utility assistance, transportation, and short-term services across the Greater Houston region.

name: Mamie George Community Center – Catholic Charities (Fort Bend)
description: Senior-focused center offering food assistance (including a self-select pantry for Fort Bend residents over 60) plus other support services.

name: Fort Bend Care Center – Food Programs
description: Runs Food Fairs with the Houston Food Bank and a Food Market (appointments) offering fresh produce and groceries in a judgment-free environment.

name: Houston Food Bank – Find Food / Find Help
description: Search tool and helpline to locate food pantries, mobile distributions, and SNAP assistance across Fort Bend and Harris Counties (including Katy/Cinco Ranch).

name: Katy ISD – Nutrition & Food Services
description: Provides school breakfast and lunch (including free/reduced-price meals for eligible families) across Katy and Cinco Ranch campuses.

name: Katy ISD – McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance
description: Support for students experiencing homelessness, including help with school meals, transportation, and links to community resources through the district liaison.

name: Katy ISD – Parent & Family Support / Community Resources
description: District-maintained community resource information and referrals for families (food pantries, clothing, emergency assistance) connected to Katy ISD.

name: Katy Christian Ministries Crisis Center
description: Crisis services for survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault, and connections to essential resources through KCM programs.

name: Family Hope – Fulshear
description: Food pantry and social services for families in the Fulshear/West Katy corridor in partnership with the Houston Food Bank.
address: Fulshear, TX (see site for exact address)

name: Katy Texas Stake – Community Resources
description: Faith-based community directory listing vetted local providers (e.g., food pantry and social services) serving Katy/West Houston.

name: United Way 2-1-1 Texas
description: Statewide hotline and directory connecting callers to local food, housing help, utility assistance, and other services by ZIP code.

name: Fort Bend County Libraries
description: Library system offering community resources, internet access, and branch programming across Fort Bend County (including Cinco Ranch-area branches).

name: Harris County Public Library – Maud Smith Marks Branch
description: Katy-area library branch offering public computers and staff help locating local services and resources.

name: Harris County Public Health – WIC
description: WIC services including healthy food benefits, nutrition education, breastfeeding support, and referrals for eligible women, infants, and young children.

name: Texas Health & Human Services – SNAP Food Benefits
description: State program providing monthly benefits to help eligible low-income households buy food; apply online or at local HHSC offices.

name: Texas Health & Human Services – TANF Cash Help
description: Temporary cash assistance for very low-income families with children for essentials such as food, clothing, housing, and utilities.

name: BakerRipley / Neighborhood Centers
description: Community centers providing food distributions, basic needs assistance, and case management across Greater Houston (program-dependent).

name: Gulf Coast Community Services Association (GCCSA) – Emergency Services
description: Emergency food pantry plus rent and utility assistance for qualifying households within service area.

name: The Beacon – Day Center Services
description: Day center with hot meals, showers, laundry, and case management for people experiencing homelessness in Harris County.

name: Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of Galveston-Houston
description: Nonprofit providing food assistance, emergency financial assistance, and case management across Greater Houston (program and location dependent).

name: Texas WIC
description: WIC benefits and clinic locator for women, infants, and children in Texas (including Fort Bend-area clinics).

name: Katy Clinic – Spring Branch Community Health Center
description: Community health center offering primary care, pediatrics, behavioral health, screenings, labs, physicals, and vaccinations in Katy.

name: West Houston Clinic – Spring Branch Community Health Center
description: Clinic providing primary care and behavioral health services for West Houston and nearby Katy/West Harris neighborhoods.

name: Oceans Behavioral Hospital Katy
description: Behavioral hospital providing inpatient and outpatient treatment for depression, anxiety, substance use, and psychiatric conditions for adults in the Katy area.

name: Branches Katy – West Oaks Hospital Outpatient Program
description: Partial hospitalization and intensive outpatient programs for children, adolescents, and adults with behavioral health needs.
address: 2900 Commercial Center Blvd, Suite 102, Katy, TX 77494

name: Fort Bend County Behavioral Health Services
description: County behavioral health department providing programs such as evaluations, case management, youth services, and trauma-focused supports, especially for justice-involved or at-risk individuals.

name: Fort Bend County Behavioral Health – Crisis Intervention Team (CIT)
description: Crisis Intervention Team response connecting people in mental health crises to services and alternatives to jail/ER use.

name: Fort Bend County Behavioral Health – Community & Youth Programs
description: Recovery, reintegration, youth education, case management, and wrap-around supports for families in Fort Bend County.

name: Harris County Public Health – Behavioral Health Services
description: Behavioral health screening, brief intervention, counseling, and referrals for Harris County residents via public health clinics.

name: The Menninger Clinic – Houston
description: Psychiatric hospital offering inpatient and outpatient programs for adults and adolescents with complex mental health conditions.

name: West Houston Counseling Center – Katy
description: Counseling practice in Katy providing therapy for children, teens, adults, couples, and families, including evidence-based treatment and neurofeedback.

name: Fort Bend County Health & Human Services
description: County health department providing clinical health services and public health programs for Fort Bend residents.

name: Fort Bend County Indigent Health Care Program
description: Provides basic medical services for eligible low-income Fort Bend County residents through contracted providers and clinics.

name: Fort Bend County WIC (County Program Page)
description: WIC program information for Fort Bend County including health screenings, nutrition education, breastfeeding support, and referrals.

name: Harris County Public Health – WIC (Service Page)
description: WIC clinic information and services for eligible Harris County families, including West Houston/Katy-area residents in Harris County.

name: Texas HHS – 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline (Texas info page)
description: 24/7 crisis line routing to trained counselors for mental health crises, suicide risk, or emotional distress (statewide).

name: Houston Methodist West Hospital
description: West Houston hospital near Katy offering medical care plus social work and behavioral health referrals.

name: Memorial Hermann Katy Hospital
description: Acute care hospital in Katy with emergency/inpatient medical services and case management/referrals to behavioral health resources.

name: Texas Children’s Hospital – West Campus
description: Pediatric hospital campus serving Katy/West Harris with child/adolescent care and access to behavioral health and psychiatry services.

name: Katy ISD – Counseling & Mental Health Services
description: K–12 counseling and mental health supports, crisis response, and referrals for students and families across Katy ISD (including Cinco Ranch).

name: Fort Bend ISD – Counseling & Behavioral Health
description: School counseling services including crisis intervention and connections to community mental health resources for students.

name: Lamar Consolidated ISD – Guidance & Counseling
description: Academic and mental health counseling, crisis response, and referrals for students and families.

name: The Harris Center for Mental Health and IDD
description: Local mental health authority for Harris County offering intake, psychiatric services, counseling, and crisis care for adults and children.

name: Texana Center
description: Local mental health and IDD authority for Fort Bend County providing outpatient psychiatric care, counseling, crisis services, and support programs.

name: Fort Bend County Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA2) Program
description: County program providing rent and utility assistance for eligible Fort Bend renters (program caps and documentation apply).

name: Fort Bend County Social Services – Rent/Mortgage Assistance
description: One-time rent or mortgage assistance for qualifying Fort Bend residents; appointments required.

name: Fort Bend County Social Services – Utility Assistance
description: Emergency assistance for eligible Fort Bend residents to help prevent utility disconnection.

name: Harris County Community Services Department (CSD) – Housing & Community Resources
description: County department overseeing housing stability and community resources for Harris County residents, including parts of West Harris.

name: Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs – Help for Texans
description: State portal to search by county for rental assistance, utility bill help, and other housing programs.

name: Salvation Army Texas – Utility, Mortgage & Rent Assistance
description: Connects Texans to local Salvation Army emergency assistance for rent, mortgage, and utility help (availability varies by location).

name: Catholic Charities – Financial Stability
description: Financial stability services that may include rent/mortgage/utility assistance depending on funding, plus case management.

name: Houston Housing Authority
description: City housing authority providing housing choice vouchers and public housing for income-eligible families within Houston service areas.

name: Fort Bend County Housing Authority
description: Provides housing choice vouchers and related housing programs for income-eligible Fort Bend County residents.

name: East Fort Bend Human Needs Ministry
description: Nonprofit providing emergency assistance to qualifying East Fort Bend residents for essential living expenses such as rent, mortgage, and utilities (and related support).

name: Lone Star Legal Aid
description: Free civil legal assistance for low-income individuals (housing, consumer rights, family law, and more).

name: St. Frances Cabrini Center for Immigrant Legal Assistance (Catholic Charities)
description: Low-cost/free immigration representation including naturalization, asylum, and family-based petitions.
address: 5599 San Felipe St Suite 300, Houston, TX 77056

name: Tahirih Justice Center (Houston Office)
description: Free legal and social services to immigrant women and girls fleeing gender-based violence.
address: 1717 Saint James Place Suite 450, Houston, TX 77056

name: Fort Bend County Willie Melton Law Library
description: Public law library offering legal research materials and self-help forms for county residents.

name: Houston Volunteer Lawyers (HVL)
description: Houston Bar Association pro bono service providing legal aid for veterans, family law, probate, and more.

name: YMCA International Services (Houston)
description: Legal services for refugees and immigrants, including adjustment of status and work authorizations.

name: Beacon Law
description: Pro bono legal help focused on ID restoration and government benefits for low-income and homeless individuals.

name: RAICES (Houston Office)
description: Free and low-cost legal services for underserved immigrant children, families, and individuals.

name: Kids in Need of Defense (KIND) Houston
description: Represents unaccompanied immigrant and refugee children in deportation proceedings.

name: Harris County Robert W. Hainsworth Law Library
description: Public law library with legal research databases and support for self-represented litigants (including virtual hearing stations).

name: Texas Legal Services Center (TLSC)
description: Statewide nonprofit providing legal advice via phone and virtual access points for issues including healthcare and seniors’ rights.

name: AVDA (Aid to Victims of Domestic Abuse)
description: Free legal representation for domestic violence survivors for divorce, custody, and protective orders.

name: Harris County Immigrant Legal Services
description: County-supported immigration legal services through community partners, including naturalization assistance and removal defense.

name: BakerRipley – Immigration & Citizenship Services
description: Low-cost legal assistance and workshops for residency and citizenship applications.

name: Houston Lawyer Referral Service (HLRS)
description: Nonprofit referral service connecting residents with prescreened attorneys at reduced initial consultation rates.

name: Fort Bend County District Clerk
description: Official department for civil filings and passport services in Fort Bend County.

name: Justice For All Immigrants
description: Legal services to low-income immigrants and refugees, focused on family reunification and citizenship.

name: Texas Access and Visitation Hotline
description: Statewide hotline providing legal information regarding child custody, visitation, and paternity.

name: Memorial Hermann Legal Health Clinic
description: Medical-legal partnership helping patients with legal issues affecting health, such as housing conditions or insurance denials.

name: NAACP Houston – Legal Redress Program
description: Investigates and refers civil rights complaints for residents who believe their rights were violated.

name: Bond Assistance Program (Harris County)
description: Information and assistance for low-income individuals navigating bail and bond processes in Harris County.

name: Texas Attorney General – Child Support Division (Richmond Office)
description: Government office that helps establish paternity and enforce child support orders.

name: University of Houston Immigration Clinic
description: Law school clinic representing immigrants in asylum and crime victim cases under supervision.

name: Houston Immigration Legal Services Collaborative (HILSC)
description: Collaborative resource hub with hotline and resource map for immigration legal services.

name: City of Katy Senior Services (Fussell Senior Center)
description: Senior center offering activities, exercise, trips, and wellness programming for seniors.

name: The Arc of Katy
description: Day programs and social opportunities for teens and adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities.

name: Fort Bend County PINNACLE Senior Center
description: Senior facility with aquatic fitness, fitness center, and computer classes for Fort Bend seniors.
address: 5525 Hobby Rd Bldg C, Houston, TX 77053

name: Harris County Area Agency on Aging (City of Houston)
description: Coordinates nutrition programs, in-home services, and caregiver support for older adults.

name: Fort Bend Seniors Meals on Wheels
description: Home-delivered meals and congregate dining supporting independence for Fort Bend seniors.

name: The Arc of Fort Bend County
description: Advocacy and resource navigation for individuals with IDD and their families in Fort Bend County.
address: 407 Julie Rivers Dr, Sugar Land, TX 77478

name: Texas Workforce Commission – Vocational Rehabilitation Services
description: Employment-focused services helping people with disabilities prepare for, find, and keep jobs.

name: H-GAC Area Agency on Aging
description: Regional agency serving older adults and caregivers in the Gulf Coast region with benefits counseling and support.

name: METROLift (METRO Paratransit)
description: ADA paratransit shared-ride service for people with disabilities who cannot use fixed-route buses.

name: Fort Bend County Public Transportation (Fort Bend Transit)
description: Fort Bend Transit services including demand-response and commuter options with accessible vehicles.

name: Easter Seals Greater Houston
description: Services for people with disabilities including therapy, early intervention, and related supports.
address: 4888 Loop Central Dr Suite 200, Houston, TX 77081

name: Texas HHS – Aging & Disability Resource Centers (ADRC)
description: No-wrong-door access point for information about long-term services and supports across Texas.

name: Social Security Administration
description: Federal agency handling disability (SSDI/SSI) and retirement benefits; local offices serve the Katy region.

name: Katy ISD Transportation Department
description: Manages school bus routes and student transportation services for Katy ISD, including specialized transportation as needed.

name: METRO (Houston METRO)
description: Public transit provider for Harris County including park & ride and local bus routes serving the Katy corridor.

name: City of Katy Office of Emergency Management
description: Coordinates city emergency planning and disaster response for the City of Katy.

name: Fort Bend County Homeland Security & Emergency Management (HSEM)
description: County emergency management office providing alerts, evacuation resources, and hazard mitigation for Fort Bend.

name: ReadyHarris – Harris County Office of Homeland Security & Emergency Management
description: Primary hub for Harris County emergency alerts, flood updates, and disaster recovery resources.

name: KTALERT (City of Katy Mass Notification System)
description: Official City of Katy notification system for time-sensitive emergency alerts via text/email/phone.

name: FBC Alert (Fort Bend County Emergency Notifications)
description: Opt-in alert system for Fort Bend residents for severe weather and critical incident notifications.

name: Harris County Flood Warning System (HCFWS)
description: Real-time rain gauge and water level data for bayous and creeks across Harris County, including the Katy area.

name: Fort Bend County Drainage District
description: County drainage district information and flood mitigation infrastructure for Fort Bend County.

name: State of Texas Emergency Assistance Registry (STEAR)
description: Registry for Texans who may need extra assistance during evacuations due to disability, medical, or functional needs.

name: American Red Cross – Texas Gulf Coast Region
description: Disaster relief including shelter, food, and emotional support after disasters such as home fires and hurricanes.

name: Texas Division of Emergency Management (TDEM)
description: Statewide emergency response and recovery coordination, including FEMA liaison and mitigation planning.

name: National Weather Service – Houston/Galveston Office
description: Official forecasts, severe storm warnings, and hurricane advisories for the Houston/Katy region.

name: CenterPoint Energy – Outage Tracker
description: Outage tracking and restoration estimates for power outages in the Greater Houston area (including Katy).
